thread.title: Harold Wright

title: Harold Wright
text:
0 
Harold Wright, 80, a Coraopolis resident since 1963, passed away peacefully on Thursday, October 22, 2015, at West Hills Health and Rehab surrounded by his loving family. 
He was born in Mobile, AL, on December 23, 1934, to the late Sam and Ethel (Merriweather) Knox. In addition to his parents, he was preceded by siblings, Willa Mae French, Mary Frances Robinson and Samuel Knox; a daughter, Donna Andrews; devoted sister-in-law, Arlene Council, and a niece, Tammy Arlene Johnson. 
He was the beloved husband for 54 years to Marie (Council) Wright, whom he married on Dec. 3, 1960; loving father of Fred Wright of Mobile, AL; brother of Ethel M. Gibby of Battle Creek, MI; also survived by a devoted sister-in-law, Shirley Martin; devoted nieces: Kim Marie Haskins and Lori Rippy; two devoted nephews: Orin (Camille) Jefferson of Potomac Falls, VA and Darold (Helen) Whitfield of Mobile, AL; a devoted great-nephew, Omari (Cori) Ricks; two well-loved great-nieces: Brittany Rippy and Kamellah "Princess" Jefferson; six cherished grandchildren, devoted nephew, Rev. Dr. Robert (Jevena) Robertson of Oak Park IL; niece, Virginia (Carl) George of Douglasville GA; devoted nephew, Rev. Dr. Melvin G. Rippy of Wheeling WV; goddaughter, Lauren Gandy, and a host of nieces, nephews and friends. 
Harold was a member of Mt. Olive Baptist Church, where he was an usher and choir member. He retired in 1983 from LTV Steel where he had been a shear man for 33 years, Aliquippa Works. He proudly served in the U.S. Air Force as a Corporal stationed in Japan during the Korean War. 
Visitation Tuesday from 11 a.m. until the time of service at 1 p.m. in the COPELAND CORAOPOLIS FUNERAL HOME, 867 Fifth Ave., www.copelandfuneralhomes.com . Rev. Dr. Melvin Gerard Rippy, officiating. Burial will follow in Coraopolis Cemetery with full military honors.
